result.execSummary:
The defendant Shea S. KEAGLE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(2r).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Attempted Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution to the City of Manitowoc Worker's Compensation.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety except for the medications prescribed to him and to be taken in prescribed doses.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Any counseling as recommended by the agent.

Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-21-14 at 9:30 a.m.  Plea date is set for 05-19-14 at 10:30 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  
State is requesting an adjournment of preliminary hearing because the officers are not available.  Defendant is willing to waive the time limits within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing reset to 03-17-14 at 3:30 p.m.  
Defense has filed a motion to modify bond.  Court will modify bail to $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with Manitou Manor, defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety and defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours.  Bail furnished.

Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 03-11-14 at 2:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Jewel Scharenbroch, Public Defender.
RE:  Officer Place, on 03-01-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of battery to law enforcement fficer and resist officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-10-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and that he maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
